features: A 6-pack of non-rechargeable Streamlight CR123A lithium 3-volt batteries
Excellent replacement for any standard 3-volt lithium battery
Perfect for flashlight and digital camera use, or any device requiring a standard 3-volt lithium battery

Perfect for use with flashlights, film and digital cameras and any other device that uses the following battery models: 123A, CR123A, CR123, CR17345, K123A, VL123A, DL123A, 5018LC, EL123AP, SF123, SF123A, 3V
body.description: Product Description Streamlight non-rechargeable CR123A 3-volt lithium batteries are an excellent replacement for any standard 3-volt lithium battery. Streamlight's battery of choice for all compatible Streamlight flashlights. Perfect for use with flashlights, film and digital cameras, or any device requiring a standard 3-volt lithium battery. Compatible with any device that uses the following battery models: 123A, CR123A, CR123, CR17345, K123A, VL123A, DL123A, 5018LC, EL123AP, SF123, SF123A, 3V. Storage life of nearly 10 years. Available in 2, 6, or 12 packs (each sold separately). From the Manufacturer The 3V CR123 Streamlight Lithium Battery is the best as a replacement for any standard 3-volt (123 CR123 123A) lithium battery. These Streamlight Lithium Batteries are extremely popular for the flashlights and digital camera use and will work just fine for any device that needs a standard 3V Lithium battery. Streamlight 3V Lithium Flashlight Batteries can be used in flashlights, film and digital cameras and any other device that uses the following battery models: 123A, CR123A, CR123, CR17345, K123A, VL123A, DL123A,5018LC, EL123AP, SF123, SF123A 3V Lithium Battery. Streamlight Lithium Batteries are the replacement battery of choice for Streamlight Scorpions, Streamlight Twin-Tasks TT-1L, Stream light Twin Tasks 2L, Streamlight Tactical Lights TL-2, Streamlight Tactical Flashlights TL-2LED, Streamlight TL-3 Tactical Lights, Streamlight Tactical Flash-lights TL-3 LED, Streamlight Night Fighters NF-2, Streamlight Night Fighter Flashlights NF-2 LED, Streamlight Tactical Gun Mount Flashlights. Streamlight Lithium Batteries is a 3 volt CR123A lithium battery with a shelf life of nearly 10 years.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Product Specifications: Streamlight X Series flashlights, also known as Dual Fuel Flashlights, can use either CR123A disposable batteries or SL-B26 rechargeable batteries. This is due to special circuitry in Streamlight X Series flashlights. These batteries are not interchangeable in any other Streamlight flashlights. Streamlight 3V CR123A batteries are not recommended for use with smoke detectors. Streamlight 3V CR123A Batteries Non-rechargeable 3-Volt Lithium Streamlight CR123A lithium batteries are an excellent replacement for any standard 3-volt lithium battery. Compatibility: Streamlight's battery of choice for all compatible Streamlight flashlights. Perfect for use with compatible Streamlight flashlights, film, and digital cameras. Not recommended for use with smoke detectors. Perfect for flashlight and digital camera use (NOT recommended for use with smoke detectors) Storage life of nearly 10 years Available in 2, 6, or 12 packs (each sold separately) Compatible Streamlight Flashlights include ProTacs, PolyTacs, Scorpions, and others

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Low Price, High Quality!
reviews.reviewText: I used to buy my batteries from Costco, Walmart or Batteries Plus. This model of battery cost me between $2.50 and $3.50 each, depending where I could find them. They weren't always available where I usually shop.I decided to check Amazon for these batteries since Amazon had almost everything else and, low and behold, here they were. Not only were they available, but I could buy a dozen batteries for less than $1.60 each. I couldn't even find these batteries at Costco on my last visit (sometimes they have them, sometimes they don't) Batteries Plus sells this exact same battery, 12 ea., for $26.99 and Walmart sell these same batteries for $33.83. Amazon sell these for $18.66 and, if you're an Amazon Prime member, shipping is FREE!I use these batteries to power two different handgun laser sites and five different flashlights which are mounted to five different weapons, from pistols, to rigles and shotguns.This is just some of the equipment that I and my fellow officers use during our duty day. If the batteries that power our various pieces of electronic equipment are unreliable it could someone to be injured or killed. That being said, I have the upmost confidence in these batteries.These batteries work fine and have lasted a bit longer than the "popular, name brand" batteries. Because of the lower price of these batteries, when compared to what other stores offer, I can order a bunch and keep enough extras on-hand at work to not only replace my batteries as necessary, but to also provide batteries for my fellow officers in the event that their batteries wear out.Bottom line, these batteries work as well and a bit better than the "name brand" batteries, they cost a lot less and they seem to "always" be available through Amazon, unlike the other stores where I've bought these batteries where it's hit or miss that they'll be in stock. My life and the lives of my fellow officers and civilians depend on these batteries working properly to power our equipment. I would not recommend these batteries to anyone if I didn't rely on these batteries myself.Considering the dependability, superior value, equivelent battery life and ready availability, I'll be buying these and other batteries from Amazon from now on. An additional bonus is that I won't have to drive into town for batteries anymore, saving me a bunch of money in gas.So.....if anyone can find a better battery at a better price let me know. I have a feeling that I won't be hearing from anyone any time soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They last and don’t leak like duraswell’s.
reviews.reviewText: Bought a streamlight flashlight that uses these or double a’s and it just kicks maglites butt. 1/2 again more light. Batteries are always a sore point environmentally but at least these last longer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good price and quality
reviews.reviewText: These batteries are always needed and you can trust stream light to provide a quality product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don't like the brightness of thes batteries doesn't last longer than the three hours, at such an expensive price.Other than that they are great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent life span
reviews.reviewText: These batteries are great for my flashlight I use at my job. I work in plastic injection molding. Sometimes I need a good bright light to look inside of the molds for any residue, scratches,etc. My flashlight takes 2 of these type batteries and they work great. I get a solid steady bright stream and long life from each use. Definitely a must have if you own a flashlight that takes 5his type battery.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good replacement for surefire
reviews.reviewText: Got these for my surefire flashlight. Seems to be working pretty good and at better price compared to surefire ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Streamlight is a great company with great products. I'm glad Amazon had these in stock when I needed them. These batteries are working great, as expected. I love how fast and convenient Amazon's shipping is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have a Canon Eos Rebel 35mm camera that I've owned for about 20 years. Since the advent of cell phones with ever better cameras and editing software, my poor Canon fell by the wayside for quite some time. I recently recovered iit, cleaned it up and ordered fresh batteries. These batteries used to be very expensive, around $6 to $14 apiece. Now you can find them for a pittance. I also have a Nikon M-10 manual camera, which uses 2 of those little LR44 button batteries,which operate the viewfinder light meter. I use the Nikon for extended night pics of the Milky-way, and for experimental infra red photography. The Canon takes really great portrait photos. 😎
The price for 6 was what the big box stores wanted for 2. They last me for a long time.

Necesitaba esta baterías para una linterna, y me sorprendió ver que la fecha de "caducidad" es hasta el 2032. Y el precio es muy bueno, las he visto en paquetes individuales, por casi el costo de un paquete de estos.

reviews.reviewerName: アンダーアーマー小僧
reviews.reviewTitle: 自然放電が少なく、長期にわたって使用が可能
reviews.reviewText: 家で使用しているストリームライトはリチウムイオン充電池なのですが、万が一のことを考えてCA123乾電池も準備しています。災害時の対応も考えておかないといけませんからね、自然放電も少なくて、いざ使う時に威力を発揮してくれるようです。（まだ使用していませんが）
Worked great for motion detector battery replacement. See how long they last
Llego al siguiente dia de que las pedí, con Prime.Funcionan muy bien las baterias
